tool.name: IMPUTE2

param.name: chromosome
param.label: Chromosome Number
param.help: For X chromosome please just enter x

param.name: phased_or_not
param.label: Are your haplotypes phased or unphased?
param.help: Unphased data will produce slightly more accurate results but take longer to run

param.name: buffer_size
param.label: Buffer Size
param.help: Length of buffer region (in kb) to include on each side of the analysis interval. Using a buffer region helps prevent imputation quality from deteriorating near the edges of the analysis interval. Larger buffers may improve accuracy for low-frequency variants (since such variants tend to reside on long haplotype backgrounds) at the cost of longer running times.

param.name: ne
param.label: Effective Population Size
param.help: Commonly denoted as Ne in the population genetics literature from which your dataset was sampled. This parameter scales the recombination rates that IMPUTE2 uses to guide its model of linkage disequilibrium patterns

tool.help:
This tool uses IMPUTE2 a program for imputation. It can accept pre-phased data (e.g. from ShapeIT) or unphased data which is recommended for smaller regions.
More information can be found here http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/impute_v2.html
